basics.name: Branden Hing
basics.label: NRT Trainee
basics.summary: I am an NRT DESCARTES trainee studying for a MA in Economics in the Department of Economics at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2025.

work.summary: As a CSM, my primary responsibilities were to oversee the adoption process of Netskope's software within a customer's environment, which could involve any number of tasks such as:
highlights: Tracking software deployment and security policy implementation within a client's IT infrastructure
Relaying updates regarding critical bugs or feature requests between relevant internal and external stakeholders
Developing playbooks and other resources to help communicate best practices to both executive and technical roles
Conducting quarterly business reviews of a customer's adoption process of the technology, both as customer-facing and internal presentations

During my 3-1/2 years in this position, I was concurrently managing over 40 different customers of varying sizes, from small-to-medium sized business to Fortune 500 companies, overseeing nearly 100 unique accounts over the course of my time at Netskope

Analyzed data logs from perimeter security devices (proxies and firewalls) and from Netskope's deep API inspection engine to communicate risk and potential threats regarding data usage and leakage within a customer's environment

Utilized spreadsheet and display tools to create visual presentations with qualitative observations formed on the basis of quantitative data sets, highlighting the number of observed instances of risks like PII/PCI leakage, anonymity network usage, overexposed sensitive/proprietary data, etc.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
